alert.note: Alert for Pacific (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 12 at 2:54AM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Washington, including the following counties, Pacific and Wahkiakum. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 250 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in additional flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Frances, Grays River, Raymond, South Bend, Ilwaco, Lebam, Rosburg, Naselle, Tokeland, Menlo, Willapa, Deep River, Sutico, Nemah and Altoona. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
